Strip Markdown from Manuscript

Source: R/strip_manuscript.R
strip_manuscript.Rd

Strip Markdown from Manuscript

strip_manuscript(file)

Arguments

file

A markdown file for parsing

Value

A data.frame with text and edits

Examples

if (requireNamespace("english", quietly = TRUE)) {
 file = system.file("extdata", "08_DST_R_packages.md",
 package = "didactr")
 # from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37462126/regex-match-markdown-link
 # md_regex = "(?:__|[*#])|\[(.*?)\]\(.*?\)"
 res = strip_manuscript(file)
 res
}

#> # A tibble: 221 x 12
#>    text     is_code original_text   is_image image_link empty header bold_header
#>    <chr>    <lgl>   <chr>           <lgl>    <chr>      <lgl> <lgl>  <lgl>      
#>  1 ""       FALSE   "# R packages"  FALSE    ""         FALSE TRUE   FALSE      
#>  2 ""       FALSE   ""              FALSE    ""         TRUE  FALSE  FALSE      
#>  3 "Now th… FALSE   "Now that we'v… FALSE    ""         FALSE FALSE  FALSE      
#>  4 ""       FALSE   ""              FALSE    ""         TRUE  FALSE  FALSE      
#>  5 ""       FALSE   "### What is a… FALSE    ""         FALSE TRUE   FALSE      
#>  6 ""       FALSE   ""              FALSE    ""         TRUE  FALSE  FALSE      
#>  7 "So far… FALSE   "So far, anyth… FALSE    ""         FALSE FALSE  FALSE      
#>  8 ""       FALSE   ""              FALSE    ""         TRUE  FALSE  FALSE      
#>  9 "*Side … FALSE   "*Side note:* … FALSE    ""         FALSE FALSE  FALSE      
#> 10 ""       FALSE   ""              FALSE    ""         TRUE  FALSE  FALSE      
#> # … with 211 more rows, and 4 more variables: image <lgl>, bullets <lgl>,
#> #   item_list <lgl>, item_number <chr>
